But the solitude or degeneracy of the provinces could no longer supply a race of men to handle those weapons‚ to guard those walls, to navigate those ships, and to reduce the theory of war into bold and successful praffice. The genius of Belisarius and Narses had been formed without a master, and expired without a disciple.
